name: 歐洲地理文化的幻象與相遇
comment: 提供臺大歐盟學程選課
restrict: ◎第一階段限 歐洲文化學程
description: This course explores various manners in which the Europeans have historically imagined and conceptualized otherness. With a focus on such aspects as ‘wonder,’ ‘otherness’ or ‘Orientalism,’ this course takes students from classical Greece to contemporary times and discusses both unbridled fascination (sinophilia) and radical rejection (racial theories) in Europeans’ perceptions about themselves and others.
goals: explores various manners in which the Europeans have historically imagined and conceptualized otherness
syllabus:
1\. Introduction: unicorns and Orientalism

2. The Others of classical times: From the Scythians to the Seres

3.  Legends of Asia / Other Medieval Others

4. The Inside Other

5. Chronicling the Other: Early travel collections/Columbus and his journals 

6.  Learning about the world: the story of maps

7. Classification and accommodation in the 16th and 17th centuries

8\. The ‘near’ otherness: The Turk

9\. Types: "the wise Chinese," "the noble savage," new paradigms

10\. Orientalism and empire, words and images

11\. Stereotyping the Other in popular culture.

12\. Problems today: conclusion
